temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: Brucella can survive at temperatures between 20 and 40°C. Growth takes places only under laboratory conditions, where its optimal temperature is 34°C.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: Brucellae are strictly aerobic, but certain strains require a CO2 enriched atmosphere (5 to 10%) in order to grow under laboratory conditions.

ph.title: pH
ph.content: Brucella can survive with a pH between 5.8 and 8.7.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: The survival of Brucella (B. abortus and B. melitensis) in the environment is promoted by humid conditions.
